arts.ttl: Bochum keeper hit by lighter at Union Berlin so teams agree to play out draw
arts.sum: Goalkeeper struck in stoppage time with score at 1-1 Referee takes teams off, then Bochum put striker in goal Bochum will protest to the German football association after their goalkeeper Patrick Drewes was hit by a lighter in their Bundesliga draw at Union Berlin on Saturday, with the teams later returning to the pitch to finish the match without trying to score. With the game level at 1-1 and added time ticking down, the 31-year-old Drewes was hit by a lighter thrown from the crowd, causing him to fall to the ground. “He is currently being taken to the hospital where he will be completely checked again, and then we will wait and see,” said Bochum’s coach, Dieter Hecking. arts.ttl: Bochum to file protest against the result of Union Berlin match
arts.sum: Bochum's managing director, Ilja Kaenzig, has announced that his side will lodge a protest after the 1-1 draw at Union Berlin, in which goalkeeper Patrick Drewes was hit by a lighter, leading to a lengthy delay in proceedings. Horst Heldt, Managing Director of Union Berlin: "The referee stopped the game because an individual threw a lighter at the Bochum goalkeeper.

arts.ttl: Unsightly Drewes incident leaves sour note in Bochum's stalemate with Union Berlin
arts.sum: The 10-men of VfL Bochum looked set to grind out a 1-1 draw against Union Berlin before an incident involving Patrick Drewes halted the action for 15 minutes before play resumed.

arts.ttl: 15:30 Kickoffs: Mainz stun Bayern, wins for Leverkusen and Gladbach, ugly scenes in Union-Bochum
arts.sum: It was a busy day around Bundesrepublik as FC Bayern Munich had their lead at the Bundesliga summit cut after a shock 2-1 defeat to Mainz. Bayer Leverkusen enjoyed a comfortable 2-0 victory over FC Augsburg to edge closer to the Bavarian giants in the table. Elsewhere, Borussia Mönchengladbach made light work of Holstein Kiel, while Union Berlin and Bochum encountered delays after an incident with more to follow.

arts.ttl: Union Berlin vs Bochum preview: Hosts look to bounce back
arts.sum: Union Berlin are set to host struggling VfL Bochum at Stadion An der Alten Försterei on Saturday in their 14th fixture of the 2024-25 Bundesliga season.
